title: Drawing, 1922
medium: Black crayon, stumped, pen and black ink, brush and black wash, varnish on  illustration board
signed: Signed in pen and black ink, lower right: Hugh Ferriss
inscribed: Inscribed in black chalk, verso: #4 (underlined)/Return to Hugh Ferriss/101 Park Ave/New York, NY, USA
description: Rendering of  very dark, monumental high-rise building consisting of tall set back central tower, flanked by two smaller towers, each with set back upper stories. Dramatic "fan" of light rays in background.  This is an early proposal for the set back skyscraper form that was to characterize many skyscrapers built from the mid-1920s to the ca. 1950s.

exhibitions.title: Nancy and Edwin Marks Collection Gallery: Treasures from the Collection
The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1922.
1922. Black crayon, stumped, pen and black ink, brush and black wash, varnish on  illustration board. Gift of Mrs. Hugh Ferriss. 1969-137-4.
